noun.description: A person who draws, pours out, or serves drink, especially alcohol; a tapster.

origin: Late 16th century; earliest use found in William Patten (d. ?1598), author. From skink + -er. Compare Middle Dutch schenker, scenker, scinker, sceinker (early modern Dutch schinkere), Middle Low German schenker (German regional (Low German) schenker), Middle High German schenker (German Schenker).
